item.title: Go Happy Path: the Unindented Line of Sight
item.description: Readability is a property we all love about Go. In other languages, it might be fine to have a lot of nested if statements; in Go, it is a good practice to keep away from overly-nested logic.

item.title: Why is GO111MODULE everywhere, and everything about Go Modules (updated with Go 1.17)
item.description: GO111MODULE is all over the place. It appears in README install instructions, in Dockerfiles, in makefiles. On top of that, the behavior of GO111MODULE has changed from Go 1.11 to 1.12, changed again with Go 1.13 and Go 1.15 and changed a last time in Go 1.16, and is stable since then.

item.title: What the heck are Conditions in Kubernetes controllers?
item.description: Although progress is being made, Kubernetes controllers and operators still require prior knowledge about Kubernetes internals. Information on how to set the status is scattered across comments, issues, PRs and the Kubernetes code itself. Conditions may be a good solution for your controller, but for what?
